column4: just wondering if anybody can help me with a dhcp problem, when booting it sits on configuring network devices for quite awhile, ends up not getting a lease on eth1, but as soon as i type dhclient eth1 at a prompt it gets a lease, any ideas?
in daemon.log it shows it doing a dhcpdiscover multiple times, but never getting a offer, when i run it manually it gets a offer right away
do you run dhclient with any arguments?
simply dhclient eth1 at the prompt
what's in /etc/network/interfaces ?
eth0 is my local net, which is setup static
there should be something link auto eth1 if you want it to autoconfigured
something like "auto eth1" i mean
http://paste.ubuntulinux.nl/3218
first auto statement might be the only one it's seeing. try "auto eth0 eth1"?
alright ill try that, but i can see it trying to use dhclient on eth1 in the logs
not to mention the auto lo above that.
nevermind, the man page says there can be multiple auto statements
strange
what's the dhcp server?
does it have any logs?
http://paste.ubuntulinux.nl/3219
the first one is when a /etc/init.d/networking restart is done
where it actually gets the lease is me doing a dhclient eth1
see what happens if you take the auto statement for eth1 out and run it manually at start-up
if i run it manually
it works fine
Well, I can't think of anything other than dumping ``route'' and ``ifconfig -a'' output from your networking script
maybe the dhcp packets are getting swalled by something
